header_summary: The email exchange discusses various concepts related to "PathCoin," including the idea of "Cold channels" that allow payments to offline entities without the need for a hot wallet. Covenant Time Locked Contracts (CTLCs) are introduced as a way to control the flow of money. Optimistic PathCoin is described as a simple variant with limitations. Safety issues faced by lightning and second time-sensitive layers are mentioned, along with new problems related to counterparty channels. Several options are suggested to address these issues. Additionally, Michael Ford announces the availability of Bitcoin Core version v26.0rc2 binaries for download, serving as a candidate for a new major release of Bitcoin Core.

recent_posts.title: Cold channels and PathCoin redux
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses different concepts related to PathCoin, including CTLCs and Cold channels.
- The optimistic variant of PathCoin allows participant A to choose a fixed path and make payments.
- The email explores tradeoffs and limitations of these concepts while highlighting their potential benefits.

recent_posts.title: The Pinning & Replacement Problem Set
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses lightning and time-sensitive layer safety issues caused by full blocks.
- The new replacement issue is that the counterparty channel can defer confirmation of spend.
- Antoine suggests multiple options to address the problem, including reverting to a static world.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- A new transaction-relay jamming attack called replacement cycling affects lightning channels.
- Major lightning implementations have implemented mitigations to protect against this attack.
- Bitcoin applications using timelocks or multi-party transactions should investigate the impact of replacement cycling attacks.

active_posts.title: [Mempool spam] Should we as developers reject non-standard Taproot transactions from full nodes?
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin network congested due to side projects like BRC-20, causing issues with real transactions.
- Taking action like implementing BIPs or commits into Bitcoin Core codebase suggested.
- Another solution could be implementing a run-time option to prune non-standard Taproot transactions.

active_posts.title: OP_Expire and Coinbase-Like Behavior: Making HTLCs Safer by Letting Transactions Expire Safely
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the issue of the HTLC-preimage path remaining spendable even after the HTLC-timeout path becomes spendable.
- Traditionally, transactions are designed to remain valid forever to avoid them becoming impossible to mine.
- The sender proposes the use of OP_Expire and the Coinbase Bit soft-fork upgrade to address the issue.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- A new transaction-relay jamming attack in lightning channels poses security risks.
- Major lightning implementations have introduced mitigations to prevent the attack.
- Aggressive rebroadcasting, monitoring, and adjusting default CLTV delta are strategies to mitigate the attacks.

active_posts.title: OP_Expire and Coinbase-Like Behavior: Making HTLCs Safer by Letting Transactions Expire Safely
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a problem with the HTLC-preimage path remaining spendable despite the HTLC-timeout path.
- The sender proposes using OP_Expire and Coinbase Bit soft-fork upgrade to address the issue.
- The sender suggests redefining a bit of the nVersion field and using OP_Expire opcode as potential solutions.

active_posts.title: Examining ScriptPubkeys in Bitcoin Script
active_posts.summary:
